title: Confounding font
content:
Hello everyone, this is my first post here. I couldn't figure out this font with whatthefont or identifont or the help of a few co-workers, or going through my whole font library one at a time, so I ask if you recognize this font.

I have a photo of the font, and a version where I blackened a selection of the letters, and a version where I blackened and sheared the letters back to an angle that seemed non-italicized. Thanks guys.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713193015im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Service_C_4575.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713193015im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Service_C_blackened_5915.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713193015im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Service_C_blackened_and_sheared_4681.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713193015im_/http:/typophile.com/files/968652_6443.JPG)
author: TysonO

comments.content:
It must be **[Crillee EF (Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713193015/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Elsner%2BFlake&ffam=CrilleeEF%20-%20Italic&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=4bfc7dd488a557d394eb1fce9df228cb&wrap=2&text=Service%20C%20968652)** by Elsner+Flake

Edit: Jodie is right - the original type-foundry is Letraset ;)
Thanks, you guys are precise and fast!
